result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Janice S Loyd

records.addlTxt: Hearing on January 4, 2023 at 09:00 am.

9:00 AM Defendant Janice S Loyd in court.  Attorney Nicholas M Weege in court for Janice S Loyd.  Prosecuting attorney Kristi J Gordon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense just received an offer from the State and requests another date to review offer with client. Defense has discovery. Court sets FP date.
Hearing scheduled for January 4, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on October 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:23 AM Defendant Janice S Loyd in court.  Attorney Nicholas M Weege in court for Janice S Loyd.  Prosecuting attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. This is a continuation from the preliminary hearing on 08/31/2022. Waukesha County Sheriff's Department Detective Ryan Roeglin sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Schmidt. Attorney Weege does not have any further questions for the State's witness. State rests. State moves for bind over with argument. Attorney Weege objects to bind over and moves to dismiss without argument. Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 21, 2022 at 09:15 am.

9:29 AM Defendant Janice S Loyd in court.  Attorney Tyler Jochman for attorney Nicholas M Weege in court for Janice S Loyd.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Peter Tempelis for attorney Shawn N Woller in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty. Tempelis requests identification will be addressed at an adjourned preliminary hearing.  City of Waukesha Police Officer Draelon Leija sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Tempelis.  Cross examination by Atty. Jochman.  Redirect.  Recross.  Atty. Tempelis requests an adjournment.  Atty. Jochman objects to an adjournment.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 21, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Attorney Nicholas Weege
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

Status conference on August 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 31, 2022 at 09:15 am.

BOND CONDITIONS MODIFIED ON 07/27/2022:    If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.

PREVIOUS CONDITIONS:
Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant allowed one trip to the residence accompanied by a peace/police officer to obtain personal items.

09:33 AM Defendant Janice S Loyd in court with attorney Ricardo Tapia.  Alyssa M Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Tapia is moving to withdraw from the case.
The Defendant does not object.
The Court will withdraw attorney Tapia and will have the SPD appoint a new attorney to the Defendant.
Preliminary time limits previously waived.
The Court will adjourn.
The Court will set a Status Conference for status of counsel - should an attorney be appointed the Status Conference will be taken off the calendar.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
